unnormalised: My journey through academia, especially with the Indian education system, has been a rollercoaster. Looking back, it feels like just yesterday I was nervously awaiting my Class 10th results. I remember logging onto the CBSE website, heart pounding, to finally see that fateful percentage: 88.2%. For a middle-class kid from Patna, that was considered pretty good. I immediately showed my mark sheet to my parents, who were really very happy.
normalised: My journey through academia, especially with the Indian education system, has been a rollercoaster. Looking back, it feels like just yesterday I was nervously awaiting my Class tenth results. I remember logging onto the C-B-S-E website, heart pounding, to finally see that fateful percentage: eighty eight point two percent. For a middle-class kid from Patna, that was considered pretty good. I immediately showed my mark sheet to my parents, who were really very happy.

unnormalised: That moment of validation fuelled me to pursue Science in Class 11th and 12th. The pressure to crack the IIT-JEE was immense, a constant buzz in every coaching center. I spent countless hours studying, fuelled by chai and the hope of securing a decent rank. I enrolled in FIITJEE, where Mr. Sharma, our physics teacher, inspired and pushed us constantly.
normalised: That moment of validation fuelled me to pursue Science in Class eleventh and twelfth. The pressure to crack the I-I-T-J-E-E was immense, a constant buzz in every coaching center. I spent countless hours studying, fuelled by chai and the hope of securing a decent rank. I enrolled in F-I-I-T-J-E-E, where Mister Sharma, our physics teacher, inspired and pushed us constantly.

unnormalised: Finally, the day arrived, the results were going to be published. The pressure was immense. I nervously logged into the IIT JEE website and entered my credentials. I did relatively well. I was awarded a rank of 2784 and it meant that I could go to a decent IIT for an Engineering Degree.
normalised: Finally, the day arrived, the results were going to be published. The pressure was immense. I nervously logged into the I-I-T J-E-E website and entered my credentials. I did relatively well. I was awarded a rank of two thousand seven hundred and eighty four and it meant that I could go to a decent I-I-T for an Engineering Degree.

unnormalised: The next big milestone was my B.Tech. I chose Computer Science at IIT Guwahati, joining in the batch of '16. Prof. Das, the HOD, was a legend, known for his challenging assignments and insightful lectures. Getting a CGPA above 8.0 was a constant struggle, but I managed to graduate with a solid 8.3 CGPA and a gold medal for being the most helpful student in my program. I really cherish this one even more than the academic certificates I received. It shows that helping people pays off in the long run.
normalised: The next big milestone was my B dot Tech. I chose Computer Science at I-I-T Guwahati, joining in the batch of sixteen. Professor Das, the H-O-D, was a legend, known for his challenging assignments and insightful lectures. Getting a C-G-P-A above eight point zero was a constant struggle, but I managed to graduate with a solid eight point three C-G-P-A and a gold medal for being the most helpful student in my program. I really cherish this one even more than the academic certificates I received. It shows that helping people pays off in the long run.

unnormalised: After graduation, I decided to get some experience in the real world. I joined TCS as a Software Engineer, and worked there for 3 long years. However, I always felt that something was missing.
normalised: After graduation, I decided to get some experience in the real world. I joined T-C-S as a Software Engineer, and worked there for three long years. However, I always felt that something was missing.

unnormalised: Driven by a thirst for deeper knowledge, I applied for a Master's program abroad. I secured admission to the University of Toronto for an M.Sc. in Artificial Intelligence. It was the right choice for me.
normalised: Driven by a thirst for deeper knowledge, I applied for a Master's program abroad. I secured admission to the University of Toronto for an M dot Sc. in Artificial Intelligence. It was the right choice for me.

unnormalised: The coursework was rigorous, and the research opportunities were unparalleled. I was very fortunate to be awarded a scholarship and the opportunity to work with a Professor who was an expert in the field of my research.
normalised: The coursework was rigorous, and the research opportunities were unparalleled. I was very fortunate to be awarded a scholarship and the opportunity to work with a Professor who was an expert in the field of my research.

unnormalised: And now, with an M.Sc. degree in hand and a few research publications under my belt, I'm eager to contribute to the ever-evolving field of AI. I just defended my thesis last month. I am very happy that it all has come to fruition. I plan to pursue a PhD soon. Wish me luck, friends.
normalised: And now, with an M dot Sc. degree in hand and a few research publications under my belt, I'm eager to contribute to the ever-evolving field of A-I. I just defended my thesis last month. I am very happy that it all has come to fruition. I plan to pursue a P-h-D soon. Wish me luck, friends.
